metadata.title: BBC News - Breaking news, video and the latest top stories from the U.S. and around the world
metadata.meta_description: Visit BBC News for the latest news, breaking news, video, audio and analysis. BBC News provides trusted World, U.S. and U.K. news as well as local and regional perspectives. Also entertainment, climate, business, science, technology and health news.

body_text: Skip to content British Broadcasting Corporation Home News Sport Business Innovation Culture Arts Travel Earth Audio Video Live Israel-Gaza War War in Ukraine US & Canada UK Africa Asia Australia Europe Latin America Middle East In Pictures BBC InDepth BBC Verify Home News Sport Business Innovation Culture Arts Travel Earth Audio Video Live Weather Newsletters News News Ukraine says 'understanding' reached with US on peace plan President Trump says the original peace plan has been "fine-tuned", and that he will send his envoy to meet Vladimir Putin. 2 hrs ago Europe Who is Trump's 'drone guy' Dan Driscoll, taking key role in Ukraine talks? The youngest-ever US army secretary has been thrust into the spotlight as the face of renewed efforts to end the years-long war. 10 hrs ago World Italian parliament unanimously votes to make femicide a crime The gender-motivated murder of a woman will now be covered by a distinct clause in Italian law - punishable by a life sentence. 6 hrs ago Europe What we know about the cruise ship death of Anna Kepner The soon-to-be high-school graduate's body was found in her cabin while she was on vacation in the Caribbean with her extended family. 7 hrs ago US & Canada Bolsonaro ordered to start serving 27-year prison sentence for Brazil coup plot The Supreme Court says the former leader has exhausted his appeals and will start his prison term at a police station in Brasilia. 8 hrs ago Latin America Who killed our children? Indian parents ask as 'house of horrors' convict acquitted Twenty years after police found the bodies of 19 women and children in Nithari, the case is back in the spotlight. 6 hrs ago Asia The looming election Trump can't afford to lose In a Tennessee district the president won by 22% last year, a Democratic upset could prompt Republican panic. 6 hrs ago US & Canada Watch: Turkeys Gobble and Waddle pardoned ahead of Thanksgiving During a White House event the president ceremoniously pardoned the birds. 11 hrs ago US & Canada 'Once in 300 years' rain hits Thai city as floods ravage South East Asia Democrats who told troops to disobey illegal orders push back on alleged FBI probe Twenty-four Nigerian schoolgirls released over a week after abduction Binance accused of aiding terrorists in new lawsuit Missing high school football coach faces child pornography charges More to explore What comes next in the James Comey and Letitia James cases? The government could appeal or attempt to retry the cases after a judge threw out the indictments 7 hrs ago US & Canada Who killed our children? Indian parents ask as 'house of horrors' convict acquitted Twenty years after police found the bodies of 19 women and children in Nithari, the case is back in the spotlight. 6 hrs ago Asia What we know about the cruise ship death of Anna Kepner The soon-to-be high-school graduate's body was found in her cabin while she was on vacation in the Caribbean with her extended family. 7 hrs ago US & Canada What happens next for Marjorie Taylor Greene after exit from Congress? The former Trump ally has decided to end her time in Congress early after a public fallout with the president. 1 day ago US & Canada 'I would love to be doing this in my 60s' - the debate over selling sex in Scotland Porcelain Victoria is concerned that a potential change in law in Scotland could drive herself and other sex workers into poverty. 9 mins ago Scotland Popemobile becomes a mobile health clinic for Gaza children The vehicle had transported the late Pope Francis on a visit to Bethlehem in 2014. 15 hrs ago Middle East Can Canada wait out the trade war with the US? Canadas prime minister is weighing a trip to Washington after recently suggesting he is in no rush to reboot derailed trade talks. 7 hrs ago US & Canada Most watched 1 'We're in a pivotal place' - Tennessee voters on Trump's performance 2 Watch: President Trump pardons Waddle and Gobble, the Thanksgiving turkeys 3 Watch: Moment truck collides with sign on Ohio highway 4 Popemobile becomes a mobile health clinic for Gaza children 5 Watch: First Lady Melania Trump welcomes the White House Christmas tree Also in news Democrats who told troops to disobey illegal orders push back on alleged FBI probe The six lawmakers say that they will not be intimidated by the Trump administration. 8 hrs ago US & Canada Foreign tourists to pay extra fee to visit US national parks Non-residents will soon have to pay a higher price to enter 11 of the United States' most popular parks. 4 hrs ago Business Viola Ford Fletcher, oldest survivor of Tulsa Race Massacre, dies aged 111 The Tulsa Race Massacre of 1921 is regarded as one of the worst episodes of racial violence in US history. 11 hrs ago US & Canada Canadian PM's office and border services not 'involved' in Kneecap ban In September, Liberal MP and Parliamentary Secretary for Combating Crime Vince Gasparro announced the ban "on behalf" of the Canadian government. 9 hrs ago Northern Ireland Ex-wife of Dubai royal says she fears arrest as custody battle escalates Zeynab Javadli's ex-husband has lodged a criminal complaint with Dubai police, accusing her of kidnapping their three daughters. 12 hrs ago Middle East Washington DC mayor Muriel Bowser won't seek re-election The Democrat has led the US capital since 2015, most recently clashing with Trump over the deployment of the National Guard. 7 hrs ago US & Canada Watch: Homes damaged as tornado, severe storms rip through Houston No injuries were reported after the severe weather outbreak damaged neighborhoods and toppled trees Monday afternoon. 15 hrs ago US & Canada Israel receives coffin that Hamas says contains Gaza hostage's body The remains will be transferred to Israeli forces, who will take them to Israel's forensic medicine institute for identification. 13 hrs ago Middle East Most read 1 The looming election Trump can't afford to lose 2 Ukraine says 'understanding' reached on US peace plan, as Trump envoy to meet Putin 3 Can Canada wait out the trade war with the US? 4 What we know about the cruise ship death of Anna Kepner 5 'I would love to be doing this in my 60s' - the debate over selling sex in Scotland 6 Sir Richard Branson 'heartbroken' as wife dies 7 Who killed our children? Indian parents ask as 'house of horrors' convict acquitted 8 'Once in 300 years' rain hits Thai city as floods ravage South East Asia 9 Foreign tourists to pay extra fee to visit US national parks 10 New Zealand woman gets life sentence for 'suitcase murders' of her children Sport 'Start believing the hype' - how 'effortless' Estevao outshone Yamal Estevao Willian outshone fellow wonderkid Lamine Yamal with a wondergoal on Tuesday - so is it "time to start believing the hype"? 5 hrs ago Chelsea Newcastle left bruised by '10 minutes of madness' With one away win in seven months, Newcastle United's problems on the road continue as they fall to a 2-1 defeat against Marseille at the Stade Velodrome in the Champions League. 6 hrs ago Newcastle Fifa to keep top seeds apart in World Cup draw The top four seeded countries will not be able to meet each other until the semi-finals of next year's World Cup for the first time in the tournament's history. 13 hrs ago World Cup 'Maybe it was too much' - Guardiola rues defeat after 10 changes Pep Guardiola celebrated taking charge of Manchester City for the 100th time in the Champions League on Tuesday night, but it was Bayer Leverkusen and their fans that were left dancing at full-time. 6 hrs ago Man City What next for friendly foes who see each other 'more than family'? Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz have dominated mens tennis in 2025. BBC Sport looks at the evolution of their growing rivalry  and where it could go next. Ronaldo clear for World Cup opener despite red card Cristiano Ronaldo will be able to play for Portugal in their opening World Cup game despite his red card against the Republic of Ireland. 14 hrs ago Portugal British Broadcasting Corporation Home News Sport Business Innovation Culture Arts Travel Earth Audio Video Live Weather BBC Shop BritBox BBC in other languages The BBC is in multiple languages Read the BBC In your own language Oduu Afaan Oromootiin Amharic   Arabic  Azeri AZRBAYCAN Bangla  Burmese  Chinese  Dari  French AFRIQUE Hausa HAUSA Hindi  Gaelic NAIDHEACHDAN Gujarati   Igbo AKK NIGBO Indonesian INDONESIA Japanese  Kinyarwanda GAHUZA Kirundi KIRUNDI Korean  Kyrgyz  Marathi  Nepali  Noticias para hispanoparlantes Pashto  Persian  Pidgin Polish PO POLSKU Portuguese BRASIL Punjabi   Russian   Serbian NA SRPSKOM Sinhala  Somali SOMALI Swahili HABARI KWA KISWAHILI Tamil   Telugu   Thai  Tigrinya   Turkish TRKE Ukrainian A Urdu  Uzbek O'ZBEK Vietnamese TING VIT Welsh NEWYDDION Yoruba RYN N YORB Follow BBC on: Terms of Use Subscription Terms About the BBC Privacy Policy Cookies Accessibility Help Contact the BBC Advertise with us Do not share or sell my info BBC.com Help & FAQs Content Index Copyright 2025 BBC. images.alt: A man in a yellow jacket walking past an apartment block with visible damage from a strike
Volodymyr Zelensky, in black mockneck, puts hand forward, which Dan Driscoll, which grey hair and navy suit, grips in both hands. In the background are gold and blue insignia and flags
Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro pictured from the neck up during an interview with Reuters in Brasilia, Brazil, on July 18, 2025. He is wearing a dark shirt and has a stern expression.

INDIA - DECEMBER 31: Natives of Nithari village, whose children are missing, demand to find their children during a protest rally organised by Foundation for Common Men Welfare Society, at Jantar Mantar in New Delhi on Sunday (Photo by Imtiyaz Khan/The The India Today Group via Getty Images)
Image shows the Democratic candidate canvassing
Up close photo of a turkey's face as it looks off camera, with the body blurred in the background.

A split of Letitia James on the left in a black top and silver chain, and James Comey on the right with a red tire and dark suit coat. They are both at chest height and appear to be mid-conversation. She is speaking into a TV news mic and he appears to be surrounded by people

INDIA - DECEMBER 31: Natives of Nithari village, whose children are missing, demand to find their children during a protest rally organised by Foundation for Common Men Welfare Society, at Jantar Mantar in New Delhi on Sunday (Photo by Imtiyaz Khan/The The India Today Group via Getty Images)

Porcelain Victoria is smiling at the camera. She has long hair, dyed bright red hair. She is wearing a black T-shirt with bright pink text on it. On the left hand side there is a collection of straps and paddles, arranged on hooks. The room is dark.
Popemobile converted inside of glass box

President Donald Trump greets Canada's Prime Minister Mark Carney during a world leaders' summit on ending the Gaza war on October 13, 2025 in Sharm El-Sheikh, Egypt. Prime Minister Mark Carney is on the left, wearing a black tie and a black suit. President Trump is on the right, wearing a dark blue suit and a red tie. PM Carney is gesturing as he speaks to Trump, who appears to be listening. Behind them is a white backdrop.
Michigan Senator Elissa Slotkin appears in Congress speaking into a microphone while Arizona Senator sits behind her out of focus.
People take photos from Glacier Point with Half Dome in the background at Yosemite National Park. A man in a red shirt is standing at the edge of a popular photo spot with is arms spread out.
Screengrab of video showing Zeynab Javadli speaking from her home in Dubai
Mayor Muriel Bowser listens during a news conference in August
Splitscreen. Left, the tornado as seen behind a fence. Right, an aerial of a house with the roof ripped off.
Masked and armed militants guard a digger at an excavation site.
Estevao Willian
Tino Livramento and Malick Thiaw react after Newcastle United's defeat against Marseille in the Champions League on 25 November, 2025
England v France
Pep Guardiola
